headline.main: A CLOSE DIVISION; Labor Issues and War Linked by Recalcitrant House Democrats ENGLAND IS DENOUNCED Nazi Victory Over Us Is Seen -- These Prophets Assailed -- All Rally for Vote Today END OF SHIP BAN IN PERIL IN HOUSE

lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, Nov. 12 -- The Administration's proposal to permit American merchant ships to enter combat zones and ports of belligerents was vigorously opposed in the House today by a recalcitrant Democratic minority, which rebelled against the Administration's failure to solve defense strikes and insisted that drastic revision of the Neutrality Act meant war.
abstract: Repr H W Smith withdraws support from Adm until Roosevelt takes firm stand

byline.original: By JAMES B. RESTONSpecial to THE NEW YORK TIMES
